channel.title: medium on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in medium on My New Hugo Site

item.title: Suspicious AdFind Execution
item.description: Detects the execution of a AdFind for Active Directory enumeration

item.title: File Was Not Allowed To Run
item.description: Detect run not allowed files. Applocker is a very useful tool, especially on servers where unprivileged users have access. For example terminal servers. You need configure applocker and log collect to receive these events.

item.title: Suspicious XOR Encoded PowerShell Command Line
item.description: Detects suspicious powershell process which includes bxor command, alternative obfuscation method to b64 encoded commands.

item.title: Explorer Root Flag Process Tree Break
item.description: Detects a command line process that uses explorer.exe /root, which is similar to cmd.exe /c, only it breaks the process tree and makes its parent a new instance of explorer

item.title: Denied Access To Remote Desktop
item.description: This event is generated when an authenticated user who is not allowed to log on remotely attempts to connect to this computer through Remote Desktop. Often, this event can be generated by attackers when searching for available windows servers in the network.

item.title: Windows Pcap Drivers
item.description: Detects Windows Pcap driver installation based on a list of associated .sys files.

item.title: Potential Remote Desktop Connection to Non-Domain Host
item.description: Detects logons using NTLM to hosts that are potentially not part of the domain.

item.title: Advanced IP Scanner
item.description: Detects the use of Advanced IP Scanner. Seems to be a popular tool for ransomware groups.

item.title: Enumeration via the Global Catalog
item.description: Detects enumeration of the global catalog (that can be performed using BloodHound or others AD reconnaissance tools). Adjust Treshhold according to domain width.

item.title: Harvesting of Wifi Credentials Using netsh.exe
item.description: Detect the harvesting of wifi credentials using netsh.exe

item.title: Windows Registry Persistence COM Search Order Hijacking
item.description: Detects potential COM object hijacking leveraging the COM Search Order

item.title: PowerShell Create Local User
item.description: Detects creation of a local user via PowerShell

item.title: Suspicious desktop.ini Action
item.description: Detects unusual processes accessing desktop.ini, which can be leveraged to alter how Explorer displays a folder’s content (i.e. renaming files) without changing them on disk.

item.title: Default Credentials Usage
item.description: Before deploying any new asset, change all default passwords to have values consistent with administrative level accounts. Sigma detects default credentials usage. Sigma for Qualys vulnerability scanner. Scan type - Vulnerability Management.

item.title: Windows Registry Trust Record Modification
item.description: Alerts on trust record modification within the registry, indicating usage of macros

item.title: Kerberos Network Traffic RC4 Ticket Encryption
item.description: Detects kerberos TGS request using RC4 encryption which may be indicative of kerberoasting

item.title: Curl Start Combination
item.description: Adversaries can use curl to download payloads remotely and execute them. Curl is included by default in Windows 10 build 17063 and later.

item.title: Cisco Denial of Service
item.description: Detect a system being shutdown or put into different boot mode

item.title: Cisco File Deletion
item.description: See what files are being deleted from flash file systems

item.title: Cisco Modify Configuration
item.description: Modifications to a config that will serve an adversary’s impacts or persistence

item.title: Cisco Show Commands Input
item.description: See what commands are being input into the device by other people, full credentials can be in the history

item.title: Cisco Sniffing
item.description: Show when a monitor or a span/rspan is setup or modified

item.title: Autorun Keys Modification
item.description: Detects modification of autostart extensibility point (ASEP) in registry

item.title: Direct Autorun Keys Modification
item.description: Detects direct modification of autostart extensibility point (ASEP) in registry using reg.exe.

item.title: Masquerading as Linux Crond Process
item.description: Masquerading occurs when the name or location of an executable, legitimate or malicious, is manipulated or abused for the sake of evading defenses and observation. Several different variations of this technique have been observed.

item.title: Clear PowerShell History
item.description: Detects keywords that could indicate clearing PowerShell history

item.title: Possible DNS Rebinding
item.description: Detects several different DNS-answers by one domain with IPs from internal and external networks. Normally, DNS-answer contain TTL >100. (DNS-record will saved in host cache for a while TTL).

item.title: Audio Capture via PowerShell
item.description: Detects audio capture via PowerShell Cmdlet

item.title: Audio Capture via SoundRecorder
item.description: Detect attacker collecting audio via SoundRecorder application

item.title: Net.exe User Account Creation
item.description: Identifies creation of local users via the net.exe command

item.title: Suspicious Bitsadmin Job via PowerShell
item.description: Detect download by BITS jobs via PowerShell

item.title: Application Whitelisting Bypass via Dnx.exe
item.description: Execute C# code located in the consoleapp folder

item.title: Possible App Whitelisting Bypass via WinDbg/CDB as a Shellcode Runner
item.description: Launch 64-bit shellcode from a debugger script file using cdb.exe.

item.title: Application Whitelisting Bypass via Bginfo
item.description: Execute VBscript code that is referenced within the *.bgi file.

item.title: Application Whitelisting Bypass via Dxcap.exe
item.description: Detects execution of of Dxcap.exe

item.title: Application Whitelisting Bypass via DLL Loaded by odbcconf.exe
item.description: Detects defence evasion attempt via odbcconf.exe execution to load DLL

item.title: Capture a Network Trace with netsh.exe
item.description: Detects capture a network trace via netsh.exe trace functionality

item.title: Windows Registry Persistence COM Key Linking
item.description: Detects COM object hijacking via TreatAs subkey

item.title: Brute Force
item.description: Detects many authentication failures from one source to one destination which is may indicate Brute Force activity

item.title: Exfiltration and Tunneling Tools Execution
item.description: Execution of well known tools for data exfiltration and tunneling

item.title: High DNS Bytes Out
item.description: High DNS queries bytes amount from host per short period of time

item.title: High DNS Requests Rate
item.description: High DNS requests amount from host per short period of time

item.title: High NULL Records Requests Rate
item.description: Extremely high rate of NULL record type DNS requests from host per short period of time. Possible result of iodine tool execution

item.title: High TXT Records Requests Rate
item.description: Extremely high rate of TXT record type DNS requests from host per short period of time. Possible result of Do-exfiltration tool execution

item.title: Tap Driver Installation
item.description: Well-known TAP software installation. Possible preparation for data exfiltration using tunnelling techniques

item.title: Tap Installer Execution
item.description: Well-known TAP software installation. Possible preparation for data exfiltration using tunneling techniques

item.title: Alternate PowerShell Hosts Pipe
item.description: Detects alternate PowerShell hosts potentially bypassing detections looking for powershell.exe

item.title: Non Interactive PowerShell
item.description: Detects non-interactive PowerShell activity by looking at powershell.exe with not explorer.exe as a parent.

item.title: PowerShell Execution
item.description: Detects execution of PowerShell

item.title: Winlogon Helper DLL
item.description: Winlogon.exe is a Windows component responsible for actions at logon/logoff as well as the secure attention sequence (SAS) triggered by Ctrl-Alt-Delete. Registry entries in HKLM\Software[Wow6432Node]Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Winlogon\ and HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Winlogon\ are used to manage additional helper programs and functionalities that support Winlogon. Malicious modifications to these Registry keys may cause Winlogon to load and execute malicious DLLs and/or executables.

item.title: Windows PowerShell Web Request
item.description: Detects the use of various web request methods (including aliases) via Windows PowerShell

item.title: Remove Immutable File Attribute
item.description: Detects removing immutable file attribute

item.title: Psr.exe Capture Screenshots
item.description: The psr.exe captures desktop screenshots and saves them on the local machine

item.title: Suspicious Code Page Switch
item.description: Detects a code page switch in command line or batch scripts to a rare language

item.title: Suspicious Keyboard Layout Load
item.description: Detects the keyboard preload installation with a suspicious keyboard layout, e.g. Chinese, Iranian or Vietnamese layout load in user session on systems maintained by US staff only

item.title: Renamed Binary
item.description: Detects the execution of a renamed binary often used by attackers or malware leveraging new Sysmon OriginalFileName datapoint.

item.title: Edit of .bash_profile and .bashrc
item.description: Detects change of user environment. Adversaries can insert code into these files to gain persistence each time a user logs in or opens a new shell.

item.title: Apache Threading Error
item.description: Detects an issue in apache logs that reports threading related errors

item.title: Command Line Execution with Suspicious URL and AppData Strings
item.description: Detects a suspicious command line execution that includes an URL and AppData string in the command line parameters as used by several droppers (js/vbs > powershell)

item.title: Execution in Webserver Root Folder
item.description: Detects a suspicious program execution in a web service root folder (filter out false positives)

item.title: Exploit for CVE-2017-0261
item.description: Detects Winword starting uncommon sub process FLTLDR.exe as used in exploits for CVE-2017-0261 and CVE-2017-0262

item.title: IIS Native-Code Module Command Line Installation
item.description: Detects suspicious IIS native-code module installations via command line

item.title: MsiExec Web Install
item.description: Detects suspicious msiexec process starts with web addreses as parameter

item.title: PowerShell Download from URL
item.description: Detects a Powershell process that contains download commands in its command line string

item.title: PowerShell Script Run in AppData
item.description: Detects a suspicious command line execution that invokes PowerShell with reference to an AppData folder

item.title: Reconnaissance Activity with Net Command
item.description: Detects a set of commands often used in recon stages by different attack groups

item.title: SquiblyTwo
item.description: Detects WMI SquiblyTwo Attack with possible renamed WMI by looking for imphash

item.title: Suspicious PowerShell Invocation Based on Parent Process
item.description: Detects suspicious powershell invocations from interpreters or unusual programs

item.title: Suspicious Process Start Locations
item.description: Detects suspicious process run from unusual locations

item.title: Suspicious RASdial Activity
item.description: Detects suspicious process related to rasdial.exe

item.title: Suspicious Reconnaissance Activity
item.description: Detects suspicious command line activity on Windows systems

item.title: Suspicious Rundll32 Activity
item.description: Detects suspicious process related to rundll32 based on arguments

item.title: Suspicious SYSVOL Domain Group Policy Access
item.description: Detects Access to Domain Group Policies stored in SYSVOL

item.title: Suspicious WMI Execution
item.description: Detects WMI executing suspicious commands

item.title: Sysprep on AppData Folder
item.description: Detects suspicious sysprep process start with AppData folder as target (as used by Trojan Syndicasec in Thrip report by Symantec)

item.title: WSF/JSE/JS/VBA/VBE File Execution
item.description: Detects suspicious file execution by wscript and cscript

item.title: SSHD Error Message CVE-2018-15473
item.description: Detects exploitation attempt using public exploit code for CVE-2018-15473

item.title: Suspicious DNS Query with B64 Encoded String
item.description: Detects suspicious DNS queries using base64 encoding

item.title: Defrag Deactivation
item.description: Detects the deactivation of the Scheduled defragmentation task as seen by Slingshot APT group

item.title: Program Executions in Suspicious Folders
item.description: Detects program executions in suspicious non-program folders related to malware or hacking activity

item.title: Suspicious Commands Linux
item.description: Detects relevant commands often related to malware or hacking activity

item.title: WMI Persistence
item.description: Detects suspicious WMI event filter and command line event consumer based on event id 5861 and 5859 (Windows 10, 2012 and higher)

item.title: Python SQL Exceptions
item.description: Generic rule for SQL exceptions in Python according to PEP 249

item.title: Suspicious OpenSSH Daemon Error
item.description: Detects suspicious SSH / SSHD error messages that indicate a fatal or suspicious error that could be caused by exploiting attempts

item.title: Secure Deletion with SDelete
item.description: Detects renaming of file while deletion with SDelete tool

item.title: Backup Catalog Deleted
item.description: Detects backup catalog deletions

item.title: Suspicious Log Entries
item.description: Detects suspicious log entries in Linux log files

item.title: PowerShell Downgrade Attack
item.description: Detects PowerShell downgrade attack by comparing the host versions with the actually used engine version 2.0

item.title: Suspicious Typical Malware Back Connect Ports
item.description: Detects programs that connect to typical malware back connect ports based on statistical analysis from two different sandbox system databases

item.title: Interactive Logon to Server Systems
item.description: Detects interactive console logons to Server Systems

item.title: Windows PowerShell User Agent
item.description: Detects Windows PowerShell Web Access

item.title: Multiple Modsecurity Blocks
item.description: Detects multiple blocks by the mod_security module (Web Application Firewall)

item.title: Suspicious Driver Load from Temp
item.description: Detects a driver load from a temporary directory

item.title: Multiple Suspicious Resp Codes Caused by Single Client
item.description: Detects possible exploitation activity or bugs in a web application

item.title: Failed Logins with Different Accounts from Single Source System
item.description: Detects suspicious failed logins with different user accounts from a single source system

item.title: Failed Logins with Different Accounts from Single Source System
item.description: Detects suspicious failed logins with different user accounts from a single source system

item.title: Eventlog Cleared
item.description: One of the Windows Eventlogs has been cleared. e.g. caused by “wevtutil cl” command execution

item.title: Addition of Domain Trusts
item.description: Addition of domains is seldom and should be verified for legitimacy.

item.title: Bitsadmin Download
item.description: Detects usage of bitsadmin downloading a file

item.title: Certutil Encode
item.description: Detects suspicious a certutil command that used to encode files, which is sometimes used for data exfiltration

item.title: Creation Of An User Account
item.description: Detects the creation of a new user account. Such accounts may be used for persistence that do not require persistent remote access tools to be deployed on the system.

item.title: Django Framework Exceptions
item.description: Detects suspicious Django web application framework exceptions that could indicate exploitation attempts

item.title: Dllhost Internet Connection
item.description: Detects Dllhost that communicates with public IP addresses

item.title: Domain User Enumeration Network Recon 01
item.description: Domain user and group enumeration via network reconnaissance. Seen in APT 29 and other common tactics and actors. Detects a set of RPC (remote procedure calls) used to enumerate a domain controller. The rule was created based off the datasets and hackathon from https://github.com/OTRF/detection-hackathon-apt29

item.title: Download from Suspicious Dyndns Hosts
item.description: Detects download of certain file types from hosts with dynamic DNS names (selected list)

item.title: Empty User Agent
item.description: Detects suspicious empty user agent strings in proxy logs

item.title: Execution of Renamed PaExec
item.description: Detects execution of renamed paexec via imphash and executable product string

item.title: Findstr Launching .lnk File
item.description: Detects usage of findstr to identify and execute a lnk file as seen within the HHS redirect attack

item.title: Firewall Disabled via Netsh
item.description: Detects netsh commands that turns off the Windows firewall

item.title: LSASS Memory Dump File Creation
item.description: LSASS memory dump creation using operating systems utilities. Procdump will use process name in output file if no name is specified

item.title: Mimikatz Command Line
item.description: Detection well-known mimikatz command line arguments

item.title: MITRE BZAR Indicators for Execution
item.description: Windows DCE-RPC functions which indicate an execution techniques on the remote system. All credit for the Zeek mapping of the suspicious endpoint/operation field goes to MITRE

item.title: MITRE BZAR Indicators for Persistence
item.description: Windows DCE-RPC functions which indicate a persistence techniques on the remote system. All credit for the Zeek mapping of the suspicious endpoint/operation field goes to MITRE.

item.title: Netsh Port Forwarding
item.description: Detects netsh commands that configure a port forwarding

item.title: Netsh Port or Application Allowed
item.description: Allow Incoming Connections by Port or Application on Windows Firewall

item.title: Network Scans
item.description: Detects many failed connection attempts to different ports or hosts

item.title: Possible Ransomware or Unauthorized MBR Modifications
item.description: Detects, possibly, malicious unauthorized usage of bcdedit.exe

item.title: Possible SPN Enumeration
item.description: Detects Service Principal Name Enumeration used for Kerberoasting

item.title: Privilege Escalation Preparation
item.description: Detects suspicious shell commands indicating the information gathering phase as preparation for the Privilege Escalation.

item.title: Process Dump via Comsvcs DLL
item.description: Detects process memory dump via comsvcs.dll and rundll32

item.title: Rar with Password or Compression Level
item.description: Detects the use of rar.exe, on the command line, to create an archive with password protection or with a specific compression level. This is pretty indicative of malicious actions.

item.title: Remote Registry Management Using Reg Utility
item.description: Remote registry management using REG utility from non-admin workstation

item.title: Remote Service Activity via SVCCTL Named Pipe
item.description: Detects remote service activity via remote access to the svcctl named pipe

item.title: Remote Task Creation via ATSVC Named Pipe
item.description: Detects remote task creation via at.exe or API interacting with ATSVC namedpipe

item.title: Remote Task Creation via ATSVC Named Pipe - Zeek
item.description: Detects remote task creation via at.exe or API interacting with ATSVC namedpipe

item.title: Ruby on Rails Framework Exceptions
item.description: Detects suspicious Ruby on Rails exceptions that could indicate exploitation attempts

item.title: Rundll32 Internet Connection
item.description: Detects a rundll32 that communicates with public IP addresses

item.title: Shadow Copies Access via Symlink
item.description: Shadow Copies storage symbolic link creation using operating systems utilities

item.title: Shadow Copies Creation Using Operating Systems Utilities
item.description: Shadow Copies creation using operating systems utilities, possible credential access

item.title: Source Code Enumeration Detection by Keyword
item.description: Detects source code enumeration that use GET requests by keyword searches in URL strings

item.title: Spring Framework Exceptions
item.description: Detects suspicious Spring framework exceptions that could indicate exploitation attempts

item.title: Suspicious Access to Sensitive File Extensions
item.description: Detects known sensitive file extensions accessed on a network share

item.title: Suspicious Access to Sensitive File Extensions - Zeek
item.description: Detects known sensitive file extensions via Zeek

item.title: Suspicious C2 Activities
item.description: Detects suspicious activities as declared by Florian Roth in its ‘Best Practice Auditd Configuration’. This includes the detection of the following commands; wget, curl, base64, nc, netcat, ncat, ssh, socat, wireshark, rawshark, rdesktop, nmap. These commands match a few techniques from the tactics “Command and Control”, including not exhaustively the following; Application Layer Protocol (T1071), Non-Application Layer Protocol (T1095), Data Encoding (T1132)

item.title: Suspicious Copy From or To System32
item.description: Detects a suspicious copy command that copies a system program from System32 to another directory on disk - sometimes used to use LOLBINs like certutil or desktopimgdownldr to a different location with a different name

item.title: Suspicious Curl File Upload
item.description: Detects a suspicious curl process start the adds a file to a web request

item.title: Suspicious Curl Usage on Windows
item.description: Detects a suspicious curl process start on Windows and outputs the requested document to a local file

item.title: Suspicious Driver Loaded By User
item.description: Detects the loading of drivers via ‘SeLoadDriverPrivilege’ required to load or unload a device driver. With this privilege, the user can dynamically load and unload device drivers or other code in to kernel mode. This user right does not apply to Plug and Play device drivers. If you exclude privileged users/admins and processes, which are allowed to do so, you are maybe left with bad programs trying to load malicious kernel drivers. This will detect Ghost-In-The-Logs (https://github.com/bats3c/Ghost-In-The-Logs) and the usage of Sysinternals and various other tools. So you have to work with a whitelist to find the bad stuff.

item.title: Suspicious PowerShell Download
item.description: Detects suspicious PowerShell download command

item.title: Suspicious PROCEXP152.sys File Created In TMP
item.description: Detects the creation of the PROCEXP152.sys file in the application-data local temporary folder. This driver is used by Sysinternals Process Explorer but also by KDU (https://github.com/hfiref0x/KDU) or Ghost-In-The-Logs (https://github.com/bats3c/Ghost-In-The-Logs), which uses KDU.

item.title: Suspicious VSFTPD Error Messages
item.description: Detects suspicious VSFTPD error messages that indicate a fatal or suspicious error that could be caused by exploiting attempts

item.title: Telegram API Access
item.description: Detects suspicious requests to Telegram API without the usual Telegram User-Agent

item.title: Telegram Bot API Request
item.description: Detects suspicious DNS queries to api.telegram.org used by Telegram Bots of any kind

item.title: Transfering Files with Credential Data via Network Shares
item.description: Transfering files with well-known filenames (sensitive files with credential data) using network shares

item.title: Transferring Files with Credential Data via Network Shares - Zeek
item.description: Transferring files with well-known filenames (sensitive files with credential data) using network shares

item.title: Unsigned Image Loaded Into LSASS Process
item.description: Loading unsigned image (DLL, EXE) into LSASS process
